thread.title_full: Neurosurgeon's license suspended following 2 patient deaths

author: Terri Sullivan
title: Neurosurgeon's license suspended following 2 patient deaths
text:
COLUMBUS, Ohio (WSYX) — A neurosurgeon at Mount Carmel East Hospital has been suspended by the Ohio State Medical Board.
The board said there's "clear" and "convincing" evidence that Dr. Jeffrey Hatef violated the Ohio Revised Code in treating patients, two of whom died.
The body also said Hatef's continued practice would present a danger to the public.
The story first came into the ABC 6 newsroom as an anonymous tip.
The allegations against Hatef were enough for the State Medical Board to suspend his license on Feb. 12.
Hatef has an office on McNaughten Road in east Columbus, right next to Mount Carmel East Hospital. His name is still on the board there
The medical board outlined in its Order for Summary Suspension three cases over a four-month period last year.
In one case, the board ruled that the surgery Hatef performed on a 72-year-old man last July was excessive or unjustified, with no evidence to support the need.
Also cited was a surgery in September on a 77-year-old woman and another in October on a 78-year-old woman. Both of those women died.
The board said that in both of those cases, the extensive surgeries and resulting complications and deaths were reasonably predictable given their ages and poor health.
The board added that Hatef's actions were a departure from, or failed to conform to, minimal standards of care.
ABC 6 asked Mount Carmel if it reported Hatef to the Ohio Medical Board, and if so, what triggered that action? The hospital responded with a statement:
We are aware that the State Medical Board has suspended Dr. Hatef’s medical license. We fully support the State Medical Board’s investigative process and will cooperate with that process. We automatically suspended Dr. Hatef’s clinical privileges at all Mount Carmel facilities and placed him on administrative leave.
The board said Hatef’s attorneys have requested an administrative hearing, but it has not been scheduled yet. ABC 6 is awaiting a reply from them.
